carrier.description: acronym of the carrier you want to use

from.description: If missing, the default sender address (if defined in your shipcloud account) will be used

service.description: The service that should be used for the shipment.

reference_number.description: a reference number (max. 30 characters) that you want this shipment to be identified with. You can use this afterwards to easier find the shipment in the shipcloud.io backoffice

description.description: text that describes the contents of the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS and the following conditions are true: from and to countries are not the same; from and/or to countries are not in the EU; from and to countries are in the EU and the shipments service is not 'standard'. The parameter is also mandatory when using DHL Express as carrier.

notification_email.description: email address that we should notify once there's an update for this shipment

name.description: key to identify the additional service

language.description: language the customer should be notified in (ISO-639-1 format)

reference1.description: Text that should be displayed as the reason for transfer

contents_explanation.description: description of contents. Mandatory if contents_type is 'commercial_goods. Max 256 characters, when using DHL as your carrier'

additional_fees.description: additional custom fees to be payed

drop_off_location.description: location where the package will be dropped of with the carrier

total_value_amount.description: the overall value of the shipments' contents

origin_country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

hs_tariff_number.description: customs tariff number. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonized_System#Tariffs_by_region for detailed information on region specific tariff numbers

quantity.description: Number that defines how many items of this kind are in the shipment

value_amount.description: The total value for items of this kind

net_weight.description: Total weight for items of this kind

create_shipping_label.description: determines if a shipping label should be created at the carrier (this means you will be charged when using the production api key)

metadata.description: here you can save additional data that you want to be associated with the shipment. Any combination of key-value pairs is possible

id.description: identifier of a previously created address

country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

phone.description: telephone number (mandatory when the following terms apply - when carrier is UPS: service is one_day or one_day_early or ship to country is different than ship from country. Carrier is DHL Express: always provide phone number.)

email.description: email address of the receiver to get notified by the carrier. Currently only used when sending shipments via GLS - ShopDeliveryService

size.description: defines the DIN size that the returned label should have

declared_value.description: Use this to book additional insurance or expand the liability for a shipment. Caution: Please keep in mind that additional fees are charged by the carrier.

description.description: text that describes the contents of the package. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS with service 'returns' or TNT with service 'one_day' or 'one_day_early'

type.description: defines packages of being of a certain type - if no value is given, parcel will be used

pickup_time.description: defined time window when the carrier should pickup shipments

pickup_address.description: address where the shipment should be picked up
